title: Oil prices lower on US-China trade tension
text: Oil prices fell in early trade on Monday, paring last week's gains, on worries the global oil glut may persist as U.S.-China trade tension could hold back an economic recovery even as coronavirus pandemic lockdowns start to ease.

title: Investors Should Be Prepared for More Volatility: Caravel Concepts
text: Michael Jones, chairman and chief executive officer of Caravel Concepts, discusses the outlook for U.S. stocks amid the coronavirus outbreak. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia."

title: Dollar firm but stocks, oil under pressure as U.S.-China tensions rise
text: The dollar rose, oil fell and stock markets were poised to slip on Monday as rising U.S.-China tensions over the coronavirus - and growing unease at the gulf between asset prices and grim economic reality - turned investors cautious.

title: Global Stock Markets Could Predict Economic Future Post Covid-19
text: Global stock markets and investors command more computing power, better software, faster networks, and the intense focus of tens of millions of individuals betting their own money.

title: ‘GDP Shrank 4.8%’ - No. Forecast 30% Drop?
text: The economists' statistical engine is running amok again

title: Oil prices open down on persistent oversupply worries
text: U.S. crude futures fell more than 5% in early trade on Monday, paring last week's gains, on worries about oil oversupply and tempered hopes for an economic recovery as some U.S. states and cities around the world ease coronavirus pandemic restrictions.

title: April Makes More Market History
text: Although still negative year-to-date, the S&P 500® and Dow Jones Industrial Average had their best month in decades, returning 12.8% and 11.2% respectively.

title: Dow futures fall nearly 300 points Sunday evening as U.S. states attempt coronavirus reopenings
text: U.S. stock-index futures fell sharply in thin trading Sunday evening as investors contended with state reopenings, with cooped-up citizens eager to to gather as spring has brought warmer weather conditions.

title: Dow futures fall more than 200 points amid concerns over reopening the economy
text: Stock futures fell on Sunday night as traders weighed the reopening of the economy along with brewing tensions between China and the U.S.

title: Stocks are in little danger of retesting the March low, top strategist Art Hogan says
text: National Securities' Art Hogan believes the consensus view that markets will stage another sharp pullback is wrong.

title: Warren Buffett: The market system is marvelous, but it needs government
text: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett and Vice Chairman Greg Abel discuss the role of capitalism in American society.

title: Reversal Spells Trouble For The Market’s Rebound
text: There were mixed earnings from the five big tech stocks but the averages and underlying technical studies painted a clearer picture.

title: President Trump’s “Tariff” Comment Stunned Retail
text: Earlier this week, President Trump resurrected his famous “tariff” word while making remarks about China.

title: Bear Market Returns As The S&P 500 Tests Risky Level Pre-FOMC
text: Last week the stock market peaked as the S&P 500 tested its monthly risky level for April.

title: Former FDIC Chair Sheila Bair discusses the government's programs to stimulate the economy
text: Former FDIC Chair Sheila Bair joins Yahoo Finance to discuss the federal government's response to the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Stocks Poised For Downward Slide As Airlines Lead Last Week’s Gains
text: While April's relief rally retraced most of March's losses, the stock market appears to be signaling that a downward slide is expected in May.

title: Kudlow says third round of PPP small business loans might be needed as demand soars
text: The second round of the Paycheck Protection Program launched last Monday and has so far provided over 2 million loans worth over $175 billion out of the total $310 billion Congress authorized in the latest relief package.

title: Profits From Fed Balance Sheet Expansion Could Top $140 Billion
text: It's time for the Fed to take a victory lap — and watch tens of billions of annual profits roll in.

title: Coronavirus Bankruptcy Tracker: These Major Companies Are Failing Amid The Shutdown
text: Some of the 20th century’s biggest names in corporate America are in danger of going the way of Sears, Blockbuster and RadioShack.

title: US unemployment hasn't looked this bad since the 1930s
text: Since the middle of March, Americans have filed more than 30 million claims for their first week of unemployment benefits, sparking a crisis of joblessness that materialized almost overnight.

title: Sentiment Speaks: 'This Market Makes No Sense'
text: Most investors and analysts have been scratching their heads while the market has continued to rally.

title: Rally Over?  The Point Is ‘Smoot’.
text: The Dow’s movement is still mimicking 1931 very closely.

title: What The Hell Is The Stock Market Doing?
text: The stock market just had its best month since 1987 and the economy just had one of its worst months ever

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: Are You Ready For Some High-Stakes Gambling?
text: Employment news is featured on the economic calendar and will command attention.
